definitions.definition: to jump on one foot or to move about in this way:
examples: I tried to hop on my good foot while holding onto Jim.

definitions.definition: to go somewhere quickly or to get into or out of a vehicle quickly:
examples: We hopped over to Bruges for the weekend.

definitions.definition: If a small animal, bird, or insect hops, it moves by jumping on all or two of its feet at the same time:
examples: The rabbit/bird hopped across the grass.

definitions.definition: a short jump by a person on one foot, or by a small animal, bird, or insect on all or two of its feet at the same time:
examples: With his feet tied together he could only move in little hops.

definitions.definition: to be a short distance, especially by plane:
examples: Rio to São Paulo is just a short hop by plane.
